PyQt6: Requires commercial license from Riverbank Computing for closed-source sale (GPL free version forces source disclosure)
PyQt5: Requires commercial license from Riverbank Computing for closed-source
PySide6: Requires Qt for Python commercial license for closed-source proprietary apps
PySide2: Requires Qt for Python commercial license
QScintilla: GPL v3 – copyleft, not allowed in closed-source apps
PyQtChart: GPL – commercial license required for closed-source
viewflow: Django-viewflow Pro edition requires paid license for commercial/private use
igraph: GPL – strong copyleft, forces source disclosure
networkx: BSD permissive, but often GPL-linked dependencies – risky for closed-source
artifex: GPL-3 – high copyleft risk (see Hancom lawsuit examples)
keygen: Fair Source License – paid license required for private/commercial distribution
devpi: Requires license disclosure for commercial/private repositories
opencv-contrib-python: Some extra modules require commercial license for proprietary use
turbodbc: Arrow/ODBC drivers may require commercial license in some cases
rdkit: Some commercial extensions require paid license
matplotlib: PSF – safe (but check backends for GPL)
gradio: AGPL license - requires making your entire source code public, even for web apps.
